metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2274 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: The OpenSSL 3.0.4 release introduced a serious bug in the RSAimplementation for X86_64 CPUs supporting the AVX512IFMA instructions. Thisissue makes the RSA implementation with 2048 bit private keys incorrect onsuch machines and memory corruption will happen during the computation. Asa consequence of the memory corruption an attacker may be able to trigger aremote code execution on the machine performing the computation. SSL/TLSservers or other servers using 2048 bit RSA private keys running onmachines supporting AVX512IFMA instructions of the X86_64 architecture areaffected by this issue.

criterions.comment: edk2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
